item.title: passing first, but still shooting
item.description: jose calderon of the toronto raptors is again a top passing guard, but his field-goal percentage is another story.

item.title: china pushes talks on north korea as kim visits
item.description: chinese premier wen jiabao defended six-party talks proposed by beijing as the way to defuse volatile divisions on the korean peninsula, even as china hosted north korean leader kim jong-il, blamed by japan and south korea for inflaming regional tensions.

item.title: hewlett-packard chief unveils strategy for expansion
item.description: l??o apotheker said he planned to take the company into cloud computing.

item.title: opec oil talks collapse, no output deal
item.description: opec talks broke down in acrimony wednesday without an agreement to raise output after saudi arabia failed to convince the oil cartel to lift production.

item.title: boj's nakamura upbeat on japan recovery
item.description: bank of japan board member seiji nakamura said solid global growth will help japan's recovery accelerate later this year but warned that the country cannot afford policy paralysis when the wounds of the devastating earthquake in march have yet to heal.

item.title: toys r us to pay $1.3 million for violating ftc order
item.description: toys r us has agreed to pay a $1.3 million penalty for violating a 1998 order that barred it from pushing suppliers to refuse to sell to competitors or from urging limits to those sales, the federal trade commission said on tuesday.

item.title: kuwait government set to quit over questioning: sources
item.description: kuwait's cabinet is expected to quit thursday after lawmakers asked to grill three ministers, the latest in a series of challenges by an unusually assertive arab parliament that have delayed important economic reforms.

item.title: mladic arrest opens door to serbia's long-sought european union membership
item.description: the capture of the former bosnian serb commander, ratko mladic, was the biggest single obstacle to serbia's path towards a european future.

item.title: texas passes bill to require sonograms before abortions
item.description: gov. rick perry is expected to sign legislation that is a victory for anti-abortion advocates.

item.title: small business: learn how to collect from slow payers
item.description: even in a tough economy, there are ways to get paid without hiring a collections agency or alienating clients.

item.title: scientists: radiation in japan food poses low risk
item.description: health risks to japanese from eating foods contaminated with elevated levels of radiation are fairly low, scientists say.

item.description: the decline leaves housing prices on the verge of a new low for a real estate downturn that seems to have no end.

item.title: fao food index to hover near record high in march
item.description: global food prices measured by the u.n.'s food agency may have come off record highs in march after falls in grain prices, but supply concerns and soaring oil prices mean such a move could just be a pause before new peaks.

item.description: thursday's strikes washed over the libyan capital from its outskirts.

item.title: tennessee hires cuonzo martin as new basketball coach
item.description: the university of tennessee announced sunday that the school has hired missouri state's cuonzo martin as the team's new basketball coach.

item.description: a study finds that residents of two nursing homes were routinely overtreated with antibiotics for common urinary tract infections -- a widespread practice, the researchers said.

item.title: pakistan taliban says attacked u.s. consulate convoy
item.description: pakistan's taliban said on friday it had attacked a u.s. consulate convoy in the volatile northwestern city of peshawar, the latest assault in a surge of violence since u.s. forces killed al qaeda leader osama bin laden this month.

item.description: organizers vowed to turn out their largest numbers yet for a protest this friday.

item.description: recently discovered film believed to be from 1927 is the latest in a string of unearthed treasures from the babe ruth era.

item.description: the bus terminal in weirton, w.va., used to be for people who were going places. these days it is a diner where no one goes anywhere.

item.title: reality tv contestants sued for revealing outcome
item.description: reality tv producers often make contestants sign confidentiality agreements and enact high penalties should secrets be leaked. so what happens when contestants have legitimate gripes and must go to court to air their grievances? do they then have the right to air the show's dirty laundry?

item.description: a sears campaign names its competitors home depot and lowe's in an attempt to gain a foothold in gardening supplies.

item.description: novak djokovic, the man who had seemed unstoppable for five months, finally met his match against old hand roger federer in the french open semi-finals on friday but the serbian had no regrets.
